Package com.stehno.ersatz.cfg

Interface Request

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RequestWithContent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ErsatzRequest, ErsatzRequestWithContent
    public interface Request
    Configuration interface for HTTP request expectations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Request called​(int count)
      Configures a call count verifier such that the number of calls must be equivalent to the provided count.
      Request called​(org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.Integer> callVerifier)
      Allows the specification of a custom call verifier so that the number of times the request is called may be matched.
      Request cookie​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
      Specifies a request cookie to be configured with the given name and value.
      Request cookie​(java.lang.String name, org.hamcrest.Matcher<Cookie> matcher)
      Specifies a request cookie to be configured with the given name and matcher.
      Request cookies​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> cookies)
      Used to configure a map of cookies on the request.
      Request cookies​(org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Cookie>> matcher)
      Specifies a matcher for matching all cookies.
      Request header​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
      Specifies a request header to be configured in the expected request.
      Request header​(java.lang.String name, org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.Iterable<? super java.lang.String>> matcher)
      Specifies a request header matcher to be configured in the expected request.
      Request headers​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> heads)
      Specifies request headers as a Map of names to values to be configured in the expected request.
      Request listener​(java.util.function.Consumer<ClientRequest> listener)
      Specifies a listener which will be called with the active request whenever this request is matched at test-time.
      Request matcher​(org.hamcrest.Matcher<ClientRequest> matcher)
      Configures a matcher for the ClientRequest, which allows ad-hoc matching based on the request.
      Request protocol​(java.lang.String proto)
      Specifies that the request protocol be equal to (case-insensitive) the specified value.
      Request queries​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> map)
      Used to specify a map of request query parameters for configuration on the expected request.
      Request query​(java.lang.String name)
      Used to specify a valueless request query parameter to be configured in the expected request.
      Request query​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Iterable<? super java.lang.String> values)
      Used to specify a request query parameter to be configured in the expected request.
      Request query​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
      Used to specify a request query parameter to be configured in the expected request.
      Request query​(java.lang.String name, org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.Iterable<? super java.lang.String>> matcher)
      Used to specify a request query parameter to be configured in the expected request.
      Request responder​(groovy.lang.Closure closure)
      Allows for configuration of a Response by the given Groovy Closure, which will delegate to a Response instance passed into it for configuration using the Groovy DSL.
      Request responder​(java.util.function.Consumer<Response> responder)
      Allows for configuration of a Response by the given Consumer, which will have a Response object passed into it.
      Response responds()
      Initiates the definition of a response for this request.

    • Method Detail

      • protocol

        Request protocol​(java.lang.String proto)
        Specifies that the request protocol be equal to (case-insensitive) the specified value.
        Parameters:
        proto - the request protocol
        Returns:
        this request

      • header

        Request header​(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String value)
        Specifies a request header to be configured in the expected request. The value specified must match one of the request header values mapped to the expected header name. Multiple header specification may be added to the expectations; each specified header must exist in the request. If an OR-style match is desired a Hamcrest Matcher should be specified (see the header(String, Matcher<Iterable<String>>) method).
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        value - the header value
        Returns:
        this request

      • header

        Request header​(java.lang.String name,
               org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.Iterable<? super java.lang.String>> matcher)
        Specifies a request header matcher to be configured in the expected request. If multiple matchers are defined with this method, each must match successfully for the request to be matched.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        matcher - the header value matcher
        Returns:
        this request

      • headers

        Request headers​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> heads)
        Specifies request headers as a Map of names to values to be configured in the expected request. The map values may be String or Matcher<Iterable<String>> instances.
        Parameters:
        heads - the map of headers
        Returns:
        this request

      • query

        Request query​(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String value)
        Used to specify a request query parameter to be configured in the expected request. As per the HTTP spec, the query string parameters may be specified multiple times with different values to denote a parameter with multiple values.
        Parameters:
        name - the parameter name
        value - the parameter value
        Returns:
        this request

      • query

        Request query​(java.lang.String name)
        Used to specify a valueless request query parameter to be configured in the expected request. As per the HTTP spec, the query string parameters may be specified multiple times with different values to denote a parameter with multiple values.

        This is equivalent to calling query(name, null).

        Parameters:
        name - the parameter name
        Returns:
        this request

      • query

        Request query​(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.Iterable<? super java.lang.String> values)
        Used to specify a request query parameter to be configured in the expected request. As per the HTTP spec, the query string parameters may be specified multiple times with different values to denote a parameter with multiple values.
        Parameters:
        name - the parameter name
        values - the list of values
        Returns:
        this request

      • query

        Request query​(java.lang.String name,
              org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.Iterable<? super java.lang.String>> matcher)
        Used to specify a request query parameter to be configured in the expected request. As per the HTTP spec, the query string parameters may be specified multiple times with different values to denote a parameter with multiple values.
        Parameters:
        name - the parameter name
        matcher - the query string matcher
        Returns:
        this request

      • queries

        Request queries​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> map)
        Used to specify a map of request query parameters for configuration on the expected request. The map values may be Strings or Matchers.
        Parameters:
        map - the map of query parameters
        Returns:
        this request

      • cookie

        Request cookie​(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String value)
        Specifies a request cookie to be configured with the given name and value.
        Parameters:
        name - the cookie name
        value - the cookie value
        Returns:
        this request

      • cookie

        Request cookie​(java.lang.String name,
               org.hamcrest.Matcher<Cookie> matcher)
        Specifies a request cookie to be configured with the given name and matcher.
        Parameters:
        name - the cookie name
        matcher - the cookie matcher
        Returns:
        this request

      • cookies

        Request cookies​(org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Cookie>> matcher)
        Specifies a matcher for matching all cookies. This is useful with the NoCookiesMatcher.
        Parameters:
        matcher - the matcher to be used
        Returns:
        this request

      • cookies

        Request cookies​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> cookies)
        Used to configure a map of cookies on the request. The map values may be Strings or Matchers. All of the configured matchers must be successful in order for the request to be matched.
        Parameters:
        cookies - the map of cookies
        Returns:
        this request

      • listener

        Request listener​(java.util.function.Consumer<ClientRequest> listener)
        Specifies a listener which will be called with the active request whenever this request is matched at test-time.
        Parameters:
        listener - the request call listener
        Returns:
        a reference to this request

      • called

        Request called​(org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.Integer> callVerifier)
        Allows the specification of a custom call verifier so that the number of times the request is called may be matched.
        Parameters:
        callVerifier - the verifier to be used
        Returns:
        a reference to this request

      • called

        Request called​(int count)
        Configures a call count verifier such that the number of calls must be equivalent to the provided count. This is analogous to calling called(equalTo(n)).
        Parameters:
        count - the expected call count
        Returns:
        a reference to this request

      • matcher

        Request matcher​(org.hamcrest.Matcher<ClientRequest> matcher)
        Configures a matcher for the ClientRequest, which allows ad-hoc matching based on the request. This does not disallow using other matcher methods, but be careful to consider any potential overlaps or unintended exclusions.
        Parameters:
        matcher - a matcher based on the ClientRequest object
        Returns:
        a reference to this request

      • responds

        Response responds()
        Initiates the definition of a response for this request.
        Returns:
        a response for this request, for configuration

      • responder

        Request responder​(java.util.function.Consumer<Response> responder)
        Allows for configuration of a Response by the given Consumer, which will have a Response object passed into it.
        Parameters:
        responder - the Consumer<Response> to provide configuration of the response
        Returns:
        a reference to this request

      • responder

        Request responder​(@DelegatesTo(value=Response.class,strategy=1)
                  groovy.lang.Closure closure)
        Allows for configuration of a Response by the given Groovy Closure, which will delegate to a Response instance passed into it for configuration using the Groovy DSL.
        Parameters:
        closure - the Consumer<Response> to provide configuration of the response
        Returns:
        a reference to this request
